intro: Peucedanum boissieri, commonly known as the Armenian cow parsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in a prickly, bristly husk, typical of the family. Peucedanum boissieri is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and can thrive in alpine environments.
